reasoning: Gout attacks (acute flares) occur in patients with gout. Incidence of acute gout attacks approximately 40-45 per 100k person-years globally. Measured as incident episodes among affected population. Based on rheumatology epidemiology and gout registry data.
source: Roddy E et al. (2014). The epidemiology of gout. Nat Rev Dis Primers. 6:1-20
